content:
Sure, here are five ideas for the proposal with an emphasis on the phygital experience:

1. "The Family Tree": This art installation focuses on celebrating heritage and family by having visitors create a family tree on paper using coloured pens and markers. After completing their tree, visitors can scan a QR code that will bring up an augmented reality experience that shows their family tree come to life with animated scenes of their ancestors.
2. "Wellness Journey": This installation focuses on wellness and invites visitors to participate in a physical activity such as yoga or tai chi. After completing the activity, visitors can scan a QR code that will bring up a virtual reality experience that takes them on a peaceful journey through a beautiful garden or natural environment.
3. "Unity Mural": This installation focuses on unity and invites visitors to contribute to a mural by drawing or painting on a canvas. After completing their contribution, visitors can scan a QR code that will bring up an augmented reality experience that shows their contribution come to life in a digital animation that merges all of the contributions into a cohesive whole.
4. "Youth Graffiti Wall": This installation focuses on youth and invites them to express their creativity by painting or drawing on a wall. After completing their artwork, visitors can scan a QR code that will bring up an augmented reality experience that allows them to see their artwork come to life in 3D or as an animation.
5. "Interactive Heritage Trail": This installation focuses on celebrating heritage and invites visitors to participate in an interactive trail that takes them through different stations featuring artefacts and stories from Singapore's history. At each station, visitors can scan a QR code that will bring up an augmented reality experience that provides more information and context for the artefacts and stories.
